devdoc.title: Interaction between a pool user and a pool

Deposit(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Tokens were deposited, available for staking or withdrawal

Stake(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Tokens were deposited, they count as shares immediatly

Unstake(address,uint256,uint256).notice: Request to unstake tokens. Additional liquidity requested for the pool

deposit(uint256).notice: Deposit tokens to user pool balance

getWithdrawBalance().notice: Returns the amount of tokens that can be immediately withdrawn by the calling user

stake(uint256).notice: Stake an amount of tokens, immediately earning pool shares in returns

unstake(uint256).notice: Unstake an specified amount of shares of the calling user

withdraw(uint256).notice: Transfer tokens back to calling user wallet

userdoc.notice: This interface models all interactions between a pool user and a pool, including staking, unstaking and withdrawing. A pool user always holds pool shares. When a user stakes tokens, he immediately receive shares. When he unstakes shares he is asking to release tokens. Those tokens need to be withdrawn by an additional call to withdraw()
